subject: Education
title: Pestalozzi: Head, Heart, and Hands
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Pestalozzi: Head, Heart, and Hands.

hook.text: A Swiss farmer-turned-teacher believed poor children deserved the same education as the rich.

buildup.text: Johann Pestalozzi opened schools for orphans and insisted on learning by doing.

discovery.text: He taught that education must develop the head, heart, and hands together.

twist.text: His schools often failed financially, yet his ideas spread across Europe.

climax.text: Pestalozzi's object lessonsâ€”learning through real thingsâ€”directly influenced Montessori.

punchline.text: The best educational ideas often come from the worst-funded schools.

quiz.question: What did Pestalozzi mean by 'head, heart, and hands'?
options: Education should develop intellect, emotion, and practical skills together
Students should study three subjects only
Teachers need three types of credentials
